line_1: O Take, O keep me, ever blest domains,
line_2: Where lovely Flora with Pomona reigns;

line_1: Where lovely Flora with Pomona reigns;
line_2: O Take, O keep me, ever blest domains,

line_1: Where Art fulfils what Nature's voice requires,
line_2: And gives the charms to which my verse aspires;

line_1: And gives the charms to which my verse aspires;
line_2: Where Art fulfils what Nature's voice requires,

line_1: Take me, the world with transport I resign,
line_2: And let your peaceful solitude be mine!

line_1: And let your peaceful solitude be mine!
line_2: Take me, the world with transport I resign,

line_1: Yet not in these retreats I boast to find
line_2: That perfect bliss that leaves no wish behind;

line_1: That perfect bliss that leaves no wish behind;
line_2: Yet not in these retreats I boast to find

line_1: This, to no lonely shade kind Nature brings,
line_2: Nor Art bestows on courtiers, or on kings;

line_1: Nor Art bestows on courtiers, or on kings;
line_2: This, to no lonely shade kind Nature brings,

line_1: Not even the Sage this boon has e'er possess'd,
line_2: Tho' join'd with wisdom, virtue shar'd his breast;

line_1: Tho' join'd with wisdom, virtue shar'd his breast;
line_2: Not even the Sage this boon has e'er possess'd,

line_1: This transient life, alas! can ne'er suffice
line_2: To reach the distant goal, and snatch the prize;

line_1: To reach the distant goal, and snatch the prize;
line_2: This transient life, alas! can ne'er suffice

line_1: Yet, sooth'd to rest, we feel suspence from woe,
line_2: And tho' not perfect joy, yet joy we know.

line_1: And tho' not perfect joy, yet joy we know.
line_2: Yet, sooth'd to rest, we feel suspence from woe,

line_1: Enchanting scenes! what pleasure you dispense
line_2: Where'er I turn, to every wondering sense!

line_1: Where'er I turn, to every wondering sense!
line_2: Enchanting scenes! what pleasure you dispense

line_1: An ocean here, where no rude tempest roars,
line_2: With crystal waters laves the hallow'd shores;

line_1: With crystal waters laves the hallow'd shores;
line_2: An ocean here, where no rude tempest roars,

line_1: Here flowery fields with rising hills are crown'd,
line_2: Where clustering vines empurple all the ground;

line_1: Where clustering vines empurple all the ground;
line_2: Here flowery fields with rising hills are crown'd,

line_1: Now by degrees from hills to Alps they rise,
line_2: Hell groans beneath, above they pierce the skies!

line_1: Hell groans beneath, above they pierce the skies!
line_2: Now by degrees from hills to Alps they rise,

line_1: See the proud summit, white with endless frost,
line_2: Eternal bulkwark of the blissful coast!

line_1: Eternal bulkwark of the blissful coast!
line_2: See the proud summit, white with endless frost,

line_1: The blissful coast the hardy Lombards gain,
line_2: And frost and mountains cross their course in vain;

line_1: And frost and mountains cross their course in vain;
line_2: The blissful coast the hardy Lombards gain,

line_1: Here glory beckon'd mighty chiefs of old,
line_2: And planted laurels to reward the bold;

line_1: And planted laurels to reward the bold;
line_2: Here glory beckon'd mighty chiefs of old,

line_1: Charles, Otho, Conti heard her trumpet sound,
line_2: And, borne on victory's wings, they spurn'd the mound.

line_1: And, borne on victory's wings, they spurn'd the mound.
line_2: Charles, Otho, Conti heard her trumpet sound,

line_1: See, on those banks where yon calm waters swell,
line_2: The hair-clad epicure's luxurious cell!

line_1: The hair-clad epicure's luxurious cell!
line_2: See, on those banks where yon calm waters swell,

line_1: See fam'd Ripaille, where once so grave, so gay,
line_2: Great Amedeus pass'd from prayer to play:

line_1: Great Amedeus pass'd from prayer to play:
line_2: See fam'd Ripaille, where once so grave, so gay,

line_1: Fantastic wretch! thou riddle of thy kind!
line_2: What strange ambition seiz'd thy frantic mind?

line_1: What strange ambition seiz'd thy frantic mind?
line_2: Fantastic wretch! thou riddle of thy kind!

line_1: Prince, hermit, lover! blest thro' every hour
line_2: With blissful change of pleasure and of power,

line_1: With blissful change of pleasure and of power,
line_2: Prince, hermit, lover! blest thro' every hour

line_1: Couldst thou, thus paradis'd, from care remote,
line_2: Rush to the world, and fight for Peter's boat?

line_1: Rush to the world, and fight for Peter's boat?
line_2: Couldst thou, thus paradis'd, from care remote,

line_1: Now by the Gods of sweet repose I swear,
line_2: I would not thus have barter'd ease for care,

line_1: I would not thus have barter'd ease for care,
line_2: Now by the Gods of sweet repose I swear,

line_1: Spight of the keys that move our fear and hope,
line_2: I ne'er would quit such penance to be Pope.

line_1: I ne'er would quit such penance to be Pope.
line_2: Spight of the keys that move our fear and hope,

line_1: Let him who Rome's stern tyrant stoop'd to praise,
line_2: The tuneful chanter of sweet georgic lays,

line_1: The tuneful chanter of sweet georgic lays,
line_2: Let him who Rome's stern tyrant stoop'd to praise,

line_1: Let Maro boast of streams that Nature pours
line_2: To lave proud villas on Italia's shores;

line_1: To lave proud villas on Italia's shores;
line_2: Let Maro boast of streams that Nature pours

line_1: Superior far the streams that court my song,
line_2: Superior far the shores they wind along:

line_1: Superior far the shores they wind along:
line_2: Superior far the streams that court my song,

line_1: Blest shores! the dwelling of that sacred power
line_2: Who rules each joyful, and each glorious hour,

line_1: Who rules each joyful, and each glorious hour,
line_2: Blest shores! the dwelling of that sacred power

line_1: Queen of whate'er the good or great desire,
line_2: The patriot's eloquence, the hero's fire,

line_1: The patriot's eloquence, the hero's fire,
line_2: Queen of whate'er the good or great desire,

line_1: Shrin'd in each breast, and near the tyrant's sword
line_2: Invok'd in whispers, and in sighs ador'd,

line_1: Invok'd in whispers, and in sighs ador'd,
line_2: Shrin'd in each breast, and near the tyrant's sword

line_1: Immortal Liberty, whose generous mind
line_2: With all her gifts would bless all human-kind!

line_1: With all her gifts would bless all human-kind!
line_2: Immortal Liberty, whose generous mind

line_1: See, from Morat she comes in martial charms,
line_2: And shines like Pallas in celestial arms,

line_1: And shines like Pallas in celestial arms,
line_2: See, from Morat she comes in martial charms,

line_1: Her sword the blood of boastful Austria stains,
line_2: And Charles, who threaten'd with opprobrious chains.

line_1: And Charles, who threaten'd with opprobrious chains.
line_2: Her sword the blood of boastful Austria stains,

line_1: Now hostile crowds Geneva's towers assail,
line_2: They march in secret, and by night they scale;

line_1: They march in secret, and by night they scale;
line_2: Now hostile crowds Geneva's towers assail,

line_1: The Goddess comes — they vanish from the wall.
line_2: Their launces shiver, and their heroes fall,

line_1: Their launces shiver, and their heroes fall,
line_2: The Goddess comes — they vanish from the wall.

line_1: For fraud can ne'er elude, nor force withstand
line_2: The stroke of Liberty's victorious hand.

line_1: The stroke of Liberty's victorious hand.
line_2: For fraud can ne'er elude, nor force withstand

line_1: She smiles; her smiles perpetual joys diffuse;
line_2: A shouting nation where she turns pursues;

line_1: A shouting nation where she turns pursues;
line_2: She smiles; her smiles perpetual joys diffuse;

line_1: Their heart-felt Paeans thunder to the sky,
line_2: And echoing Appenines from far reply:

line_1: And echoing Appenines from far reply:
line_2: Their heart-felt Paeans thunder to the sky,

line_1: Such wreaths their temples crown as Greece entwin'd
line_2: Her hero's brows at Marathon to bind;

line_1: Her hero's brows at Marathon to bind;
line_2: Such wreaths their temples crown as Greece entwin'd

line_1: Such wreaths the sons of freedom hold more dear,
line_2: Than circling gold and gems that crown the peer,

line_1: Than circling gold and gems that crown the peer,
line_2: Such wreaths the sons of freedom hold more dear,

line_1: Than the broad hat which shades the Pontiff's face,
line_2: Or the cleft mitre's venerable grace.

line_1: Or the cleft mitre's venerable grace.
line_2: Than the broad hat which shades the Pontiff's face,

line_1: Insulting grandeur, in gay tinsel drest,
line_2: Shows here no star embroider'd on the breast,

line_1: Shows here no star embroider'd on the breast,
line_2: Insulting grandeur, in gay tinsel drest,

line_1: No tissued ribbon on the shoulder tied,
line_2: Vain gift implor'd by Vanity from Pride!

line_1: Vain gift implor'd by Vanity from Pride!
line_2: No tissued ribbon on the shoulder tied,

line_1: Nor here stern Wealth, with supercilious eyes,
line_2: The faltering prayer of weeping want denies;

line_1: The faltering prayer of weeping want denies;
line_2: Nor here stern Wealth, with supercilious eyes,

line_1: Here no false Pride at honest labour sneers,
line_2: Men here are brothers, equal but in years;

line_1: Men here are brothers, equal but in years;
line_2: Here no false Pride at honest labour sneers,

line_1: Here heaven, O! Liberty, has fix'd thy throne,
line_2: Fill'd, glorious Liberty! by thee alone.

line_1: Fill'd, glorious Liberty! by thee alone.
line_2: Here heaven, O! Liberty, has fix'd thy throne,

line_1: Rome sees thy face, since Brutus fell, no more,
line_2: A stranger thou on many a cultur'd shore:

line_1: A stranger thou on many a cultur'd shore:
line_2: Rome sees thy face, since Brutus fell, no more,

line_1: The Polish lord, of thy embraces vain,
line_2: Pricks his proud courser o'er Sarmatia's plain;

line_1: Pricks his proud courser o'er Sarmatia's plain;
line_2: The Polish lord, of thy embraces vain,

line_1: Erects his haughty front in martial pride,
line_2: And spurns the burgher, grovelling at his side;

line_1: And spurns the burgher, grovelling at his side;
line_2: Erects his haughty front in martial pride,

line_1: The grovelling burgher burns with secret fires,
line_2: Looks up, beholds thee, sighs, despairs, expires.

line_1: Looks up, beholds thee, sighs, despairs, expires.
line_2: The grovelling burgher burns with secret fires,

line_1: Britain's rough sons in thy defence are bold,
line_2: Yet some pretend at London thou art sold;

line_1: Yet some pretend at London thou art sold;
line_2: Britain's rough sons in thy defence are bold,

line_1: I heed them not, to sell too proud, too wise,
line_2: If blood must buy, with blood the Briton buys.

line_1: If blood must buy, with blood the Briton buys.
line_2: I heed them not, to sell too proud, too wise,

line_1: On Belgic bogs, 'tis said, thy footsteps fail,
line_2: But thou secure may'st scorn the whisper'd tale;

line_1: But thou secure may'st scorn the whisper'd tale;
line_2: On Belgic bogs, 'tis said, thy footsteps fail,

line_1: To latest times the race of great Nassau,
line_2: Who rais'd seven altars to thy sacred law,

line_1: Who rais'd seven altars to thy sacred law,
line_2: To latest times the race of great Nassau,

line_1: With faithful hand thy honours shall defend,
line_2: And bid proud factions to thy fasces bend.

line_1: And bid proud factions to thy fasces bend.
line_2: With faithful hand thy honours shall defend,

line_1: Thee Venice keeps, thee Genoa now regains;
line_2: And next the throne thy seat the Swede maintains;

line_1: And next the throne thy seat the Swede maintains;
line_2: Thee Venice keeps, thee Genoa now regains;

line_1: How few in safety thus with kings can vie!
line_2: If not supreme, how dangerous to be high!

line_1: If not supreme, how dangerous to be high!
line_2: How few in safety thus with kings can vie!

line_1: O! still preside where'er the law's thy friend,
line_2: And keep thy station, and thy rights defend:

line_1: And keep thy station, and thy rights defend:
line_2: O! still preside where'er the law's thy friend,

line_1: But take no factious League's reproachful name,
line_2: Still prone to change, and zealous still to blame,

line_1: Still prone to change, and zealous still to blame,
line_2: But take no factious League's reproachful name,

line_1: Cloud not the sunshine of a conquering race,
line_2: Whom wisdom governs, and whom manners grace;

line_1: Whom wisdom governs, and whom manners grace;
line_2: Cloud not the sunshine of a conquering race,

line_1: Fond of their sovereign, of subjection vain,
line_2: They wish no favours at thy hands to gain,

line_1: They wish no favours at thy hands to gain,
line_2: Fond of their sovereign, of subjection vain,

line_1: Nor need such vassals at their lord repine,
line_2: Whose easy sway they fondly take for thine.

line_1: Whose easy sway they fondly take for thine.
line_2: Nor need such vassals at their lord repine,

line_1: Thro' the wide East less gentle is thy fate,
line_2: Where the dumb murderer guards the sultan's gate;

line_1: Where the dumb murderer guards the sultan's gate;
line_2: Thro' the wide East less gentle is thy fate,

line_1: Here pale and trembling, in the dust o'erturn'd,
line_2: With chains dishonour'd, and by eunuchs spurn'd,

line_1: With chains dishonour'd, and by eunuchs spurn'd,
line_2: Here pale and trembling, in the dust o'erturn'd,

line_1: The sword and bow-string plac'd on either side
line_2: Thou mourn'st, while slaves of life and death decide.

line_1: Thou mourn'st, while slaves of life and death decide.
line_2: The sword and bow-string plac'd on either side

line_1: Spoil'd of thy cap thro' all the bright Levant
line_2: Tell gave thee his, and well supply'd the want,

line_1: Tell gave thee his, and well supply'd the want,
line_2: Spoil'd of thy cap thro' all the bright Levant

line_1: O! come my Goddess, in thy chosen hour,
line_2: And let my better fortune hail thy power;

line_1: And let my better fortune hail thy power;
line_2: O! come my Goddess, in thy chosen hour,

line_1: Fair friendship calls thee to my green retreat,
line_2: O! come, with friendship share the mossy seat;

line_1: O! come, with friendship share the mossy seat;
line_2: Fair friendship calls thee to my green retreat,

line_1: Like thee she flies the turbulent and great,
line_2: The craft of business, and the farce of state;

line_1: The craft of business, and the farce of state;
line_2: Like thee she flies the turbulent and great,

line_1: To you, propitious powers, at last I turn,
line_2: To you, my vows ascend, my altars burn;

line_1: To you, my vows ascend, my altars burn;
line_2: To you, propitious powers, at last I turn,

line_1: Let me of each the pleasing influence share,
line_2: My joys now heighten'd, and now sooth'd my care;

line_1: My joys now heighten'd, and now sooth'd my care;
line_2: Let me of each the pleasing influence share,

line_1: Each ruder passion banish'd from my breast,
line_2: Bid the short remnant of my days be blest.

line_1: Bid the short remnant of my days be blest.
line_2: Each ruder passion banish'd from my breast,
